intro: Lappularia, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. These plants are typically found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. They are characterized by their small, often showy flowers that come in a variety of colors, including pink, white, and red. Lappularia species are generally drought-tolerant and have a compact growth habit. Their leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss.
